extendedInfo.description: CrashPlan: Get Your Files On-The-GoIf youâre already backing up with award-winning, cross-platform CrashPlan+, you know that it's great to automatically and securely back up to multiple locations. You also have the peace of mind knowing that you can restore anytime, anywhere. But did you know that you can securely get your files on the go with your Android phone or tablet?With the CrashPlan mobile app, you can retrieve anything that youâve backed up online to CrashPlan Central. Just browse your online backup and tap the files to download to your Android phone or tablet. Thereâs no waiting for each file to finish before you select another.After your files download to your device, you can use your compatible apps to open, view, edit, even share them via email. Best of all, One-touch Update lets you get the latest version of your downloaded files.Features: - Browse folders and files in your archive - Download and view as many files as you want - Securely access your files with your account password, private password, or data key- Learn of file updates at-a-glance and get the latest version with just a click***** You need a CrashPlan+ subscription to use the CrashPlan mobile app. *****Don't have an account? Download a 30-day free trial to get started. You can use CrashPlan+ to back up an unlimited amount of personal files for as many as 10 computers at home. You can even back up to friends and family for additional protection (Note: Only the files backed up to CrashPlan Central are accessible from the CrashPlan mobile app).* If you're already a CrashPlan PRO user, be sure to download the CrashPlan PRO mobile app instead.

reviews.title: Quite basic but works
reviews.comment: It looks nice, and it gets me my files. But, it seems you can\'t navigate up one folder. You can only go back to your \'home\' view and navigate all over again. Also, you can\'t download a folder, only a file. And I think only one file at a time. Makes me wonder if they really don\'t *want* us downloading our files and using their bandwidth.
reviews.author: Jason Olson

reviews.title: Nice app!
reviews.comment: I would like it more if it had the ability to generate thumbnails for photos. At the moment I have to individually download them until I find the one I want to access.
reviews.author: Chris Applegate

reviews.title: Love it...
reviews.comment: Remote access to all of my files is about to kill my use of other cloud services. All I want out of it now is mobile backup to my account.
reviews.author: Kyle Turpin

reviews.title: No backup
reviews.comment: Doesn\'t actually allow you to backup your mobile device. Only can access computer files that have been backed up. Pretty pointless for me without mobile backup.
reviews.author: Christine Avolio

reviews.title: Good, But Not Yet Great
reviews.comment: Provides access to all of my backed up files, but I would love to see some extra security features, i.e. Box and Dropbox. Also, I would love to be able to backup my mobile device.
reviews.author: Wayne Watkins

reviews.title: Decent
reviews.comment: I appreciate being able to see my files, but as stated before, there are some flaws. It would definitely be a five star app if you could DL multiple files, had better folder access and thumbnails for pics.
reviews.author: T Hampton-Watts

reviews.title: Great but Refresh Updated files does not work
reviews.comment: When using refresh icon in tool bar the downloaded files are not updated.  Must go to each file individually within the downloaded section and hit Update link.
reviews.author: Ken Glickman

reviews.title: Many issues to solve
reviews.comment: Cant see all backed up files, no thumbnails, no app updates. Expect more for a paid service.
reviews.author: George Holland

reviews.title: No thumbnail viewing
reviews.comment: Would rate it 5 stars if you could view thumbnails. Makes it hard to find an individual picture.
reviews.author: Paul Robbins

reviews.title: Needs an upload Feature
reviews.comment: Really wish crashplan could have a mobile upload feature.  This would be excellent in the realm of backups.
reviews.author: Aaron Paap

reviews.title: Excellent Cloud App
reviews.comment: This has worked very well. Lacks a few important features like file details,  previews, multiple file downloads in an archive. Regardless, I\'m pleased with the app and CrashPlan. Had some miserable experiences with other cloud services.
reviews.author: David Czaya

reviews.title: Good but lacks functionality
reviews.comment: I can only download one file at a time, no ability to zip selected files, no image preview. Too bad they don\'t listen to their costumers
reviews.author: Ofer Groman

reviews.title: Need thumbnails
reviews.comment: It is a great app, but please please add the ability to see thumbnails of your images so you don\'t have to download the whole photo to see if it the one you want. For those of us that are into digital photography we have thousands of photos that are just named whatever the camera names the file. We NEED to be able to view thumbnails of our photos.  Seems like everyone is requesting image previews. Please listen and provide. This is a basic feature that all other backup software I have used provide.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Backup Android Phone\'s Data?
reviews.comment: I\'d really like to be able to backup the SD Card data, such as when connected to wifi.
reviews.author: Christopher Wrinn

reviews.title: Very Happy
reviews.comment: APP is great and I\'m very happy with Crash plan great software
reviews.author: Shlomo Svei

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: Extremely useful app. Problem on the tablet display fixed, thanks!   But on the nexus 10 you can\'t even read the file/folder names on the left in portage or landscape. Fix that so its functional and koalas it for tablets and its a5 star app
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Life saver
reviews.comment: Really great to have access to all my synched files from my desktops. Would like to be able to preview/cache files instead of downloading.
reviews.author: Jon P Ybanez
